Most Illustrious Sir,

The citizen Antônio José de Abreu states that it has become necessary for the respective clerk, in view of the proceedings for the collection of the goods of the deceased intestate José Augusto Ledek, to provide him with a certificate of the order by which the Petitioner was appointed Curator of the estate of said deceased, the day, month, and year in which he took the oath, as well as the day and year on which those goods were deposited in the hands of Major Bernardo Pires, and finally the order by which the Petitioner was relieved of the office of Curator.

He requests from Your Lordship

I hope to receive Your Grace’s

Pass. Piratini, October 2, 1841. Freitas

No. 2 The citizen Antônio Belarmino Ribeiro, Clerk of Orphans and Absentees of the city of Piratini and its jurisdiction. By virtue of the foregoing order: I certify that the goods referred to by the petitioner were deposited under the custody of citizen Major Bernardo Pires on the twenty-fourth of last September, as appears in the records at page eleven. Likewise, I certify, and it appears in the same records at page fourteen, that the petitioner was appointed Curator and took the oath on the twenty-fifth of said September. I finally certify that in the aforementioned records at page twenty-one verso, it appears that the petitioner was relieved of such trusteeship on the first day of the current month of October, and replaced by the aforementioned citizen Major Bernardo Pires. The aforesaid is true, and I refer to the pertinent records. Antônio Belarmino Ribeiro
